page.title: 07Land Features
page.content: Some of the farm land will be lost to new town housing as the development approaches completion. There's a small brook called Keckwick Brook running through. Too small for fish but there are many insects living in and around it. It kooked fairly clean but I would not like any to drink. There are 16 small ponds, 4 of which we think had fish in them - they wre all fairly clean and all of them were surrounded by trees. Two of the ponds had private fishing signs up. There are four large areas of woodland with only one having more than 4000 trees. There were no signs of felling being done recently. The majority of the land is used for growing crops with a little land used for cattle.
